page.title: 13GOOSTREY ROSE DAY
page.content: Every year at the end of June Goostrey has a Rose day. For the past 79 years people have put on their costumes and joined the colourful parade to Mill Lane field. The jingle of the Morris dancers is followed by the rousing sound of the brass band. Some of the local children have been practising their dancing since April and now have their chance to perform. The retiring Rose Queen crowns her successor and then the maypole dancers begin. They are reputed never to have tangled the ribbons. There are side stalls,a raffle,a tombola,refreshments and all the fun of the fair. When the fun is over the local Scout Troop settle down to camp for their second night. Their task is to ward off over enthusiastic revellers who may return to the site.
